thread.title: Chrissy Teigen Makes Her First Post-Baby Comeback to Sports Illustrated - Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue 2017
thread.title_full: Chrissy Teigen Makes Her First Post-Baby Comeback to Sports Illustrated - Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue 2017

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Chrissy Teigen Makes Her First Post-Baby Comeback to Sports Illustrated - Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue 2017
text:
Chrissy Teigen is a Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue vet. She first appeared in its pages as "Rookie of the Year" in 2010, then appeared every year up to 2014, when she graced the cover alongside Nina Agdal and Lily Aldridge.
[767091e8-1b82-49b6-b80a-09aa757d8fcc]" class="id-input" value="767091e8-1b82-49b6-b80a-09aa757d8fcc"> [480x637]" class="selected-crop-input" value="480x637"> [inputs]" value=""> [inputs]" value=""> [inputs]" value="1xw:0.5016181229773462xh;center,top"> [inputs]" value=""> [inputs]" value="1xw:0.9405339805825242xh;center,top"> [inputs]" value="0.8860215053763442xw:1xh;center,top"> [inputs]" value="1xw:1xh;center,top"> Advertisement - Continue Reading Below She took time off to focus on her other modeling and hosting gigs—and to have the cutest baby on this planet , of course—but now she's back for the 2017 Swimsuit Issue.
In a preview for the SI Swimsuit special, editor MJ Day revealed that Chrissy wanted to wear only one-piece suits and asked if she could cover up with a blanket. She hadn't done a swimsuit shoot since having Luna in April 2016. "I forgot how stupidly painful it is to pop your ass all day," she joked.
She eventually got back into it, however, and even ended up stripping down to nothing in classic SI fashion.
[512c02df-7135-40f2-a6e8-221acbd54077]" class="id-input" value="512c02df-7135-40f2-a6e8-221acbd54077"> [4000x2666]" class="selected-crop-input" value="4000x2666"> [inputs]" value=""> [inputs]" value=""> [inputs]" value="1xw:1.0xh;center,top"> [inputs]" value=""> [inputs]" value="0.5 xw:1xh;center,top"> [inputs]" value="0. xw:1xh;center,top"> [inputs]" value="1xw:1xh;center,top"> Advertisement - Continue Reading Below "For a mother, it's nice to be able to be back in your element and it's so important to my well-being that I'm able to come out here and do something that I'm proud of," Chrissy said.
